transcript:
that they were busy, and busy making his fa- ther comfortable, while evidently he, Pierre, was only busy causing him annoyance. 
Olga went out. Pierre stood looking at the sisters; then he bowed and said: "Then I will go to my rooms. You will let me know when I can see him." 
And he left the room, followed by the low but ringing laughter of the sister with the mole. 
Next day Prince Vasili had arrived and set- tled in the count's house. He sent for Pierre and said to him: "My dear fellow, i
